reviews.review_msg: Very considerate of students time and workload.

Amazing professor, great at explaining and very passionate about teaching! It's impressive to see a professor balancing all his research alongside being an excellent teacher. You will learn a lot from him and he speaks a ton about his industry experiences as well which I love!
No exam, but you can learn a lot from the assignments.

You will spend a lot of time on the assignments but you will learn a lot. There are no exams which is really great. Some assignments are graded competitively which turns some people off.

His lectures can be confusing at times but it is a complex topic. He is happy to answer any questions and I felt like he knew his stuff. Great course!

Magnificent lecturer. Without a doubt captivated by the subject he's teaching and tries to transmit that fascination to others. Covered a huge range of topics, from classical approaches to CV and ending with generative pre-trained transformers. Homework may be hard if you've never had experience with CV, but they will change pre-req next sem.

Hi,
I took this course to learn computer vision and deep learning. But the course wasn't organized, and I wish it was better. If you want to take this course, consider that you need to dedicate a good time learning computer vision. To learn more, you need to read additional books or take online courses. If you need just a good grade, You can!

Lectures were interesting; he taught a mix of classical and modern neural network computer vision. The assignments were difficult and took a lot of time. I would have had a hard time if my semester load was heavy. Good alignment between lecture material and assignments.

Not the best CS course, but definitely not the worst either. Could have been better. The course seemed a bit unorganized. The assignments were interesting but 2 of them were competitively marked so only top students could get full marks. Overall meh course, I wish it was better. I was really looking forward to this course but I was disappointed.

This course is not hard at all. Actually, it's really easy. You don't even understand concepts completely. You can still implement algorithms in assignments without understanding them. This is an easy A course.

Assignments were not hard at all. If you spend some time on them, they are very doable. topics for the assignments are very interesting. I don't know why people would complain about the workload. If you know how to read, you should be fine.

Yas changed the course structure in this term, and it's a bit unorganized. He's trying to cover all deep learning technologies in Computer Vision, which I think is ridiculous. It's nearly impossible to understand all lectures without preliminary deep learning knowledge. Homework is more challenging than the ones in other ML courses (CMPT 419).
Explanations unclear, homework incredibly hard.
Competitively graded, with extremely tough assignments when compared to previous offerings of the course. If you really like CV, its the perfect course for you, but otherwise you'll have a bad time.

This course combined actually a lot of learning without a huge onerous work load. We demoed are projects to the TA which gave immediate feedback. Dr. Funt was struggled having to teach some reasonably dense mathematics to class with a pretty diverse mathematical background but seemed to be able to convey the essential ideas successfully.

Wow, best professor ever met. His lecture is very interesting. The material is challenging in a good way. Assignments are very helpful. One classmate got a well paid job by talking about one of the assignments we did in this course. Prof Funt is very patient to students and their questions. Very supportive for extra helps.

He looks very kind, but he is quite mean. I got 69% of total and just get C+. The average of class is C+. Exams are very surprising since we haven't done any related questions. He always say "you should be fine", but your marks will be very low if you believe him. The assignment is interesting though.
Great professor. Brian explains the points very clear and the homework was very interesting, although time consuming.

Nice guy with a very hands-on teaching style. My main complaint is that he offers no practice questions even though most of the course is heavy on math, so the only way to study for exams is to understand the abstract concepts and then hope you can solve calculation problems during the exam. If he gave written problems he would be awesome.

No textbook so you need to go to class. Always available for help and you can always ask questions in class. Allows cheat sheet for exams. Only need short to medium length answers for exams, but you have to think. Course is easier if you have MATH 251, 314 but still okay without it.
difficult but fair exam questions, easy marking, a very interesting prof, sometimes unclear.
nice prof, very helpful. It's better to learn from him than other computer vision books.Assignments are useful and pratical, exams are relatively hard.
Great prof, he explains every concept in detail and uses analogies to help with understanding. Puts very good effort into extra help for students that have questions.

Astonishing professor. He can explain the most complicated things so well and makes the subject so sweet and useful. Although he is very mathematical in class, his tests do not require much math. He just wants to to "understand" the concept. Gives suprisingly high marks! 100% recommended!
Final was an unhappy surprise.  Assignments are ambiguous.  Not a fun class...
Could have used some practice questions
Hard but awseome prof! Gives VERY high marks.
EXTREMELY HARD!!! But gives us very suprising marks!
B prepare 2 fail the course if u're not confident in ur Math abilities. Period.
No practice questions at all, so expect to see weird crazy questions in final
a very nice guy. very disorganized. forgetful (even those important equations)

We have a final report and milestones, if you don't use the "template" in the milestone, then "your final report will not be accepted." she is not good at teaching or answering emails. She took over a month to respond to an admin issue.
